info.title: Entities API
info.description: This API provides access to Entity data.

description.example: A downstream system is not responding correctly.

productId.title: product id
productId.description:
The product id of the Recipe is the unique identifier of the specific Product  that will result from following this Recipe. 

(Note: Product is part of the PRODUCT domain, which is to be defined as of v0.3.3 of this model)

recipeVersion.title: recipe version
recipeVersion.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

eventAcknowledgedByPersonId.title: event acknowledged by person id
eventAcknowledgedByPersonId.description: The event acknowledge by person id is the unique identifier of the person who has acknowledged this Process Event.

manufacturingProcessPersonName.title: manufacturing process person name
manufacturingProcessPersonName.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

productionRunStartDate-time.title: production run start date-time
productionRunStartDate-time.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

productionRunEndDate-time.title: production run end date-time
productionRunEndDate-time.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

productBatchDate-time.title: product batch date-time
productBatchDate-time.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

productBatchNumber.title: product batch number
productBatchNumber.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.
